title: Runtime permissions for WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE
message:
Runtime permissions for WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE

API target bump to 23 caused breakage on 23+ devices because runtime
permissions weren't implemented properly. This commit implements runtime
permission checks for WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE requests.

title: Upgrade Dropbox API to v2
message:
Upgrade Dropbox API to v2

Dropbox deprecated their v1 API recently. This commit adds support for
the v2 API and adds an upgrade path for the linked accounts to get
re-linked. Also use gradle dependencies to fetch the Dropbox SDK online
instead of hardcoding it in the repository.

Version updates

* Move compileSdkVersion and targetSdkVersion to 23 (Marshmallow).
* Bump play-services dependencies from 11.0.2 to 11.0.4

Upgrade to OpenSSL 1.1.0f

https://github.com/leenjewel/openssl_for_ios_and_android

Switched to using static libraries instead of shared objects.

message: README update

title: Replace in-repo Google libs with gradle dependencies
message:
Replace in-repo Google libs with gradle dependencies

Remove all the Google libraries checked into the repository under
encdroid/libs and replace their usage with gradle dependencies in
encdroid build.gradle.

Also upgrade to using 1.22.0 (latest version) of these Google libraries
instead of the old 1.16.0 versions.

Also removed the bundled googleplayservices_lib/ project and using
gradle dependencies to pull in the latest version (11.0.2) of the google
play services library.

As a side effect of this change also ended up cleaning some of the
libraries that I thought the Dropbox SDK was using (jackson, httpmime
etc.) but turns out they weren't being used.

title: Fix linking to Google Account from AccountsActivity
message:
Fix linking to Google Account from AccountsActivity

Because GoogleAccount was starting the authentication intent from the
AccountActivity context instead of the fragment context the activity
would get the result instead of the fragment. Just proxy the result to
the fragment.

Fixes mrpdaemon/encdroid #73

title: Encapsulate AsyncTask's in their own Fragment
message:
Encapsulate AsyncTask's in their own Fragment

This commit introduces TaskFragment, which is used to encapsulate an
EDAsyncTask. For the fragment we do setRetainInstance() which makes sure
that the hosting Activity will retain the fragment upon being recreated.
In TaskFragment we manage attaching/detaching to an Activity and adjust
the necessary state such as progress bars etc.

There is also a rather large refactoring of the progress reporting code
in this commit, which introduces TaskProgress which is now used by all
EDAsyncTask to report job status. In a future commit, it will be
possible to improve the ProgressDialog used with a custom implementation
since all tasks now use a common progress reporting mechanism.

title: DropboxFileProvider crash fix for volume in DB root
message:
DropboxFileProvider crash fix for volume in DB root

When we have a volume in the Dropbox root directory we would end up with
a crash in DropboxFileProvider.entryToFileInfo. This is because
apparently DropboxAPI.Entry has modified=null for the root directory.
Commit also fixes the relative path handling logic for the root
directory entry.

Fixes mrpdaemon/encdroid#70

message:
Fix DB crash on negative volume type

Through a bug it was possible for volumes to be inserted to the database
with type == -1. This commit fixes the bug in EDApplication.getFSIndex()
and patches the DBHelper code to drop affected volumes from the
database.

title: Version bump to 2.1.0
message: Version bump to 2.1.0

title: Multiple file/folder selection support
message:
Multiple file/folder selection support

This (large) commit adds support for selecting multiple files/folders
for the following operations:

* Import files/folders
* Export files/folders
* Delete files/folders
* Cut/Copy and paste files/folders

The multiple selection mode is triggered via long pressing on a file
name. A multiple item chooser interface replaces the previous context
menu. Upon making their selections the user can then choose the action
they want to invoke using the CAB (context action bar) interface.

The progress display mechanism was somewhat reworked to display a more
useful progress indication, although further work is needed to improve
on it. Currently we can show individual file names in all multiple
selection operations which can give the user a good sense of where the
long running operation is at.

title: Fix native PBKDF2 behavior with Unicode passwords
message:
Fix native PBKDF2 behavior with Unicode passwords

The native PBKDF2 provider marshalls a Java string into a byte array
using GetStringUTFChars() which expands unicode characters into 2 bytes.
However for determining the size of the character array it was using the
password length parameter passed by the Java caller, which simply uses
String.length() that counts unicode characters as a single character
resulting in truncated data for the PBKDF2 computation. Fix uses
strlen() on the GetStringUTFChars() result.

Fixes #61 in mrpdaemon/encdroid

title: Workaround for null MenuInfo in onContextItemSelected()
message:
Workaround for null MenuInfo in onContextItemSelected()

MenuItem.getMenuInfo() is returning null in onContextItemSelected() due
to proxying showContextMenu() through ListView.setOnItemLongClickListener().
This is a workaround to save the position of the currently selected list
item in the long click listener and use that in onContextItemSelected().

If we get an IOException from EncFSFile.listFiles() we would try to run

RuntimeException. Show the dialog from the UI thread instead.

title: Save/restore mOrigModifiedDate in VolumeBrowserActivity
message:
Save/restore mOrigModifiedDate in VolumeBrowserActivity

Got a crash report on Google play because of a NullPointerException in
VolumeBrowserActivity.onActivityResult() due to mOrigModifiedDate being
null. This could happen if the activity was paused and is being
restored. The fix is to save/restore mOrigModifiedDate with the rest of
the activity state.

title: Fix crash in FileChooserFillTask.onPreExecute()
message:
Fix crash in FileChooserFillTask.onPreExecute()

A similar fix was done to VolumeBrowserActivity$FillTask.onPreExecute()
but wasn't applied to FileChooserFillTask.onPreExecute(). In case the
user spams refresh the ListView can return null from getParent(), which
leads to a NullPointerException. The fix is to not create a progress bar
in these cases.

Improve exception logging

Log.e() has trouble with null strings, and passing e.getMessage() to
it would lead to issues.

title: Cancel EDVolumeBrowserActivity.FillTask onDestroy()
message:
Cancel EDVolumeBrowserActivity.FillTask onDestroy()

FillTask shouldn't carry over to the recreated activity.

title: Restore activity state for EDVolume{List|Browser}Activity
message:
Restore activity state for EDVolume{List|Browser}Activity

Prior to this commit we used the cop-out way of handling rotation events
by using 'android:configChanges="orientation|screenSize"' for
EDVolume{List|Browser}Activity. This let the app work fine when the
device is rotated, but resulted in the activity not getting destroyed
and recreated, which among other things prevented the ActionBar layout
from being recreated. Especially for tablets such as Nexus 7 the
landscape layout is dramatically more spacious than the portrait layout,
so recreating view layout is desirable.

This change reworks EDVolume{List|Browser}Activity to properly save and
restore activity state so the configChanges workaround is no longer
needed.

The change also contains cleanups in file organization.

title: Add support for external SD cards
message:
Add support for external SD cards

This commit adds a new preference for enabling volumes to be created on
and imported from an external SD card. The location of this SD card
defaults to /mnt/external1 but it is configurable through the
preferences. External SD card volumes become unavailable when the
preference is switched to disable external SD card support. A future
change could make this dynamic so we gray out volumes if we detect that
the external SD card is not mounted.

title: Fix EDVolumeBrowserActivity.onCreate() crash

Fix EDVolumeBrowserActivity.onCreate() crash

When the task is killed (due to low memory) if the user navigates back
to EDVolumeBrowserActivity (for example via Recent Tasks) we would crash
because EncFSVolume creation isn't performed in this path. Fix is to
simply return back to EDVolumeListActivity in this situation.

Fix handling filenames with spaces

It looks like MimeTypeMap.getFileExtensionFromUrl() doesn't properly
handle filenames with spaces in them, so in case it fails to grab the
correct extension we manually attempt to extract it from the filename.
